intro: Astracantha dipodura, commonly known as the two-toed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, green, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in harsh environments. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and a distinctive, spurred appearance. Astracantha dipodura is adapted to sandy soils and can thrive in areas with minimal rainfall.
